required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ablation of Supraventricular Arrhythmias With As Low As Reasonably Achievable X-Ray Exposure
clinical_study.official_title: Ablation of Supraventricular Arrhythmias With As Low As Reasonably Achievable X-Ray Exposure (AALARA)

lead_sponsor.agency: Mohamed Bin Khalifa Bin Sulman Al Khalifa Cardiac Centre

clinical_study.source: Mohamed Bin Khalifa Bin Sulman Al Khalifa Cardiac Centre

brief_summary.textblock: Observational study is to demonstrate a clinically significant reduction of ionizing radiation exposure during transcatheter ablation of supraventricular tachycardias using the EnSite precision mapping system in a real-world clinical setting without compromising efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The day of performing the procedure
primary_outcome.description: The dose of ionizing radiation exposure in patients undergoing Supraventricular Tachycardia catheter ablation utilizing a non-fluoroscopic EnSite Precision 3D mapping system

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of procedure related cardiac Adverse Events (Safety)
primary_outcome.description: Cardiac related serious adverse events frequency during and after ablation procedure of supraventricular arrhythmias

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The day of performing the procedure

intervention.description: Electrophysiology Study and Ablation of Supraventricular Arrhythmias

study_pop.textblock: Male or female patients ≥ 18 years of age, indicated for supraventricular arrhythmias ablation according to the current local applicable guidelines

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female patients ≥ 18 years of age
- Patient indicated for supraventricular arrhythmias ablation according to the current guidelines
- Patient is willing to provide written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is pregnant.
- Contraindications to ionizing radiation exposure
- Patient's life expectancy is less than 1 year
- Associated complex congenital heart disease
- Cardiac implantable electric devices
- Known pathological venous access to the heart
